Accessibility Auditor Pro

- Single-file Python 3 script using ONLY standard library (os, sys, json, pathlib, urllib.parse, webbrowser, argparse, tkinter)
- Keyboard-first TUI using tkinter with full arrow/tab/enter navigation and hotkeys (Ctrl+N new, Ctrl+S save, Ctrl+L load, Ctrl+H hash-share, Esc quit)
- Drag-and-drop file/folder support via tkinter.dnd (register drop target for file paths)
- Core purpose: Audit local files/directories for accessibility issues (file permissions, naming conventions, structure)
- Features:
  * Add files/folders via: drag-drop, keyboard entry (Ctrl+O dialog), or command line args
  * Accessibility checks (run on-demand with Enter or F5):
    * File permissions (644 files/755 dirs, readable by user/group)
    * Naming: no spaces/uppercase in filenames, descriptive extensions
    * Structure: no files >50MB, no deeply nested (>10 levels), alt-text simulation for images
    * Duplicates: hash-based detection (sha256)
  * Results table shows: path, issues (color-coded red/yellow/green), score (0-100)
  * Keyboard nav: arrows select rows, Tab cycles panels, Enter details popup
  * Persistence: auto-save/load scans to scan_data.json in script dir
  * Share: generate URL-safe base64 hash of scan summary (copy to clipboard with Ctrl+C)
- UI layout:
  * Left panel: file list (sortable by score/path)
  * Right panel: detailed issues for selection
  * Top toolbar: buttons + status (scan count, avg score)
  * Bottom: progress bar during scans
- Command line: python auditor.py [file_or_dir...] (loads initial paths)
- Hotkeys must work globally, screen-reader friendly labels/tooltips
- Output share hash example: base64.urlsafe_b64encode(json.dumps(summary).encode()).decode()[:32]
- Error handling: safe for network drives, permission errors, huge dirs (limit recursion depth=5)
- Exit cleanly with all data saved, shebang #!/usr/bin/env python3
